text.0: this chariothorse hath moved along the pathways and pavamana flowed like rain from heaven.
text.1: with us hath soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood upon his mothers bosom.
text.2: king he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers mounted the straightestgoing ship of order.
text.3: sped by the hawk the drop hath waxed in waters the father drains it drains the fathers offspring.
text.4: they come to him red tawny lord of heaven the watchful guardian of the meath the lion.
text.5: first hero in the fight he seeks the cattle and with his eye the steer is our protector.
text.6: they harness to the broadwheeled car the mighty courser whose back bears meath unwearied awful.
text.7: the twins the sisters brighten him and strengthenthese children of one damethe vigorous racer.
text.8: four pouring out the holy oil attend him sitting together in the same container.
text.9: to him they flow when purified with homage and still from every side are first about him.
text.10: he is the buttress of the heavens supporter of earth and in his hand are all the people.
text.11: be the teams lord a well to thee the singer cleansed is the sweet plants stalk for deed of glory.
text.12: fighting uninjured come where gods are feasted soma as vitraslayer flow for indra.
text.13: vouchsafe us ample riches very splendid may we be masters of heroic vigour.
